result.title: Minimum Perimeter of a Triangle Given a Set of Points
result.content:
Here is the question, in short and bulleted form:

1) You are given a set of n points (in pair form)

2) denote euclidean distance between points A and B as dist(a,b)

3) You need to find a set of 3 points (call them A,B,C) such that dist(A,B)+dist(A,C)+dist(B,C) is minimized

4) You need to output the minimum distance

Now.. one needs an O(n) solution to solve this problem, as the problem constraints say that 3 ≤ # of points ≤ 100000

I have tried using several data structures, including segment tree, but I have been unsuccessful.. I could not even improve the time complexity to O(n^2log(n)) or O(n^2). It seems that this problem involves the use of a data structure.. though I do not know how to use it.

How do you develop an O(n) solution to this problem? As i said, i have no idea how to start this problem off.. so any algorithmic ideas are appreciated.

For anyone interested, here is the full problem statement:

http://www.codechef.com/KG14ROL2/problems/ACM14KP1
